DOC.brief_summary: Due to absence of Deceased-donors in Egypt, Living-donor liver transplantation (LDLT) has emerged as an option to the traditional deceased-donor transplantation procedure. But there is an essential risk related to liver resection for healthy donors.
DOC.brief_title: Causes of Disqualification of Egyptian Potential Living Liver Donors
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of this work is to identify and analyze the causes of disqualification of potential Egyptian living liver-donors in a University based liver transplant program
DOC.criteria: All potential living liver donors in the period from June 2010 to June 2012 1. Age between 18 and 50 years 2. Relationship within 3rd degree of consanguinity with recipient or spouse. 3. The donorrecipient pair must be blood group compatible. 4. An informed consent should be obtained. Patients with nknown mrsdical or surgical history that interfere with donation Underlying medical condition (diabetes, cardiopulmonary disease, etc.). ABO incompatibility
